title: [aerospace] Frequent Delays with Specific Carriers
description: The KAL carrier has the highest number of delays (17 records) and a significant average delay time of 10.49 minutes. This could indicate operational inefficiencies or scheduling issues.

title: [aerospace] Concentration Risk in Baggage Handling
description: All baggage handling records are concentrated on a single bag type (CHECKED) and origin (ICN), which may indicate a lack of diversity in operations and potential vulnerability to disruptions.
recommendations: Expand baggage handling operations to include more bag types and origins
business_impact: Over-reliance on a single origin can lead to operational risks if disruptions occur.

title: [aerospace] Potential Underutilization of Day Shift Employees
description: With 50 employees on a rotation shift pattern compared to only 20 on a day shift, there may be an opportunity to optimize staffing and reduce costs by adjusting shift patterns.
recommendations: Evaluate workload and staffing needs for day shifts
Consider adjusting shift patterns for efficiency
business_impact: Optimizing shift patterns can lead to reduced labor costs and improved employee work-life balance.
